name: FOUNDATION FOR CREDIT COUNSELLING
activities: Foundation for Credit Counselling's principal activities are to provide free debt advice to the financially distressed and following advice either via telephone or online, to provide a range of debt management solutions to meet client needs such as debt management plans and a range of insolvency solutions.

name: Family Fund Trust
address: The Family Fund, Unit 4, Alpha Court, Monks Cross Drive, Huntington, YORK
activities: THE FAMILY FUND HELPS FAMILIES WITH SEVERELY DISABLED OR SERIOUSLY ILL CHILDREN TO HAVE CHOICES AND THE OPPORTUNITY TO ENJOY ORDINARY LIFE.  WE SUPPORT FAMILIES WITH SIGNPOSTING AND INFORMATION AND GIVE GRANTS FOR THINGS THAT MAKE LIFE EASIER AND MORE ENJOYABLE FOR THE DISABLED CHILD AND THEIR FAMILY, SUCH AS WASHING MACHINES,  HOSPITAL VISITING COSTS, COMPUTERS AND FAMILY BREAKS.

name: THE KATHERINE MARTIN CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: Provision of grants to nominated charities as directed by the will of Katherine Martin. The Structure, Governance and Management of the Trust and its trading subsidiary, Singleton Birch Ltd, is set out in the Trust's Consolidated Accounts filing, which also disclose the Trust's separate financial position. The Trust's activities are funded from investment income and dividends from its subsidiary.

name: ST ANNE'S COMMUNITY SERVICES
address: St. Annes Community Services, 6 St. Marks Avenue, LEEDS
activities: We provide support services throughout the North of England for people who are homeless, who have a learning disability, mental health problems or substance use problems. A wide range of services include Supported Living, Supported Housing, Registered Care and Nursing Homes,respite care, direct access and resettlement hostels and a range of community based support.

name: REAL LIFE OPTIONS
address: Real Life Options, David Wandless House, A1 Business Park, Knottingley Road, KNOTTINGLEY
activities: Real Life Options provides support and care to people in the United Kingdom who have disabilities.  In particular, the organisation provides and manages services on a peripatetic and domiciliary basis, and provides care and support through the provision of residential housing, both directly and in conjunction with other voluntary agencies, charities and housing associations.

name: LEEDS TRINITY UNIVERSITY
address: Leeds Trinity University, Brownberrie Lane, Horsforth, LEEDS
activities: The establishment, conduct and development of a Roman Catholic institution for the advancement of education for the benefit of the public.

name: SKILLS FOR CARE LTD
address: SKILLS FOR CARE, WEST GATE, 6 GRACE STREET, LEEDS
activities: Our aim is to develop the adult social care workforce to provide quality social care services. We do this by: developing national occupational standards and qualification frameworks; collecting and analysing workforce information and other research; implementing our national workforce development strategy for all areas of the workforce; creating employer-led workforce development infrastructures.

name: JOSEPH ROWNTREE FOUNDATION
address: JOSEPH ROWNTREE FOUNDATION, THE HOMESTEAD, 40 WATER END, YORK
activities: JRF is an independent social change organisation working to solve UK poverty. It aims to inspire action andchange that will create a prosperous UK without poverty and it principally does this by undertakingresearch, producing or inputting into policy on poverty, collaborating with others working to the samepurpose and otherwise providing practical solutions.

name: PENNY APPEAL
address: Penny Appeal Campus, Thornes Park, WAKEFIELD, West Yorkshire
activities: Penny Appeal provides poverty relief across Asia, the Middle East and Africa, with dedicated programmes to help the poor and needy by building wells, caring for orphans, providing nutritious food, delivering emergency aid in response to crisis situations and providing healthcare. Penny Appeal also works in the UK to help homeless people and women who have experienced domestic abuse.

name: THE CAMPHILL VILLAGE TRUST LIMITED
address: The Camphill Village Trust, Reg Office: The Kingfisher Offices, 9 Saville Street, MALTON
activities: For the public benefit, to provide support for adults with special needs by establishing and maintaining intentional communities of purpose where all may continue to develop as individuals through meaningful work of a productive nature, alongside a range of chosen therapeutic activities and further education, as well as a healthy cultural, social and spiritual life.

name: THE GRAMMAR SCHOOL AT LEEDS
address: LEEDS GRAMMAR SCHOOL, HARROGATE ROAD, LEEDS
activities: Provision of education for boys and girls aged 3 to 18

name: SHEFFIELD CITY TRUST
activities: 1) Promoting the benefit of the inhabitants of South Yorkshire and surrounding counties through the provision of facilities for recreation and leisure time occupation, ad hoc initiatives and the provision of financial support to appropriate projects.

name: LEEDS DIOCESAN BOARD OF FINANCE
activities: Promote the work and purposes of the Church of England in the Diocese of Leeds. The Diocese of Leeds covers the area of West Yorkshire and the Dales and Barnsley in South Yorkshire.

name: INSPIRE NORTH
activities: Activities are restricted to exclusively charitable purposes for those in need due to age, housing or mental/physical health including prevention/relief of financial hardship or other need, relieve sickness and preserve health, support with unemployment, support and promote education including advice therapy and training & promoting charities efficiency and effectiveness including use of resource.

name: WAKEFIELD GRAMMAR SCHOOL FOUNDATION
address: WAKEFIELD GRAMMAR SCHOOL FOUNDATION, GOVERNORS OFFICE, 158 NORTHGATE, WAKEFIELD
activities: The object for which the Foundation is established is to advance education by the provision of a school or schools in or near Wakefield or elsewhere in Britain and by ancillary or incidental educational activities and other associated activities for the benefit of the community.

name: AMPLEFORTH ABBEY
activities: The main object of the charity is for the furtherance of the Roman Catholic religion. The object is fulfilled by the formation and subsequent ministry of Benedictine monks of Ampleforth Abbey. The works of the monks include the maintenance of the monastic community and its property, education, the welcoming of guests and parish work in dioceses of the Roman Catholic Church.

name: THE WILF WARD FAMILY TRUST
address: WESTGATE HOUSE, 5 WESTGATE, PICKERING, NORTH YORKSHIRE
activities: The Trust delivers supported living, short breaks, residential care, direct payments support agencies and community domiciliary care services across Yorkshire for children, adults and older people. The Trust also provides vocational training and work placements through its cafe. The ethos of the organisation is to promote independence, choice and control for all people using its services.

name: YORKSHIRE CANCER RESEARCH
address: Yorkshire Cancer Research, Jacob Smith House, 7 Grove Park Court, Harrogate
activities: The charity's objects are the advancement of health or the saving of lives by undertaking research and other relevant activities in the Yorkshire region or elsewhere to help people avoid, survive or cope with cancer.

name: GOOD THINGS FOUNDATION
address: Kollider, Floor 3, Castle House, Castle Street, SHEFFIELD
activities: We support digitally and socially excluded people to improve their lives through digital. Digital technology and community action is at the heart of everything we do. We bring together community partners to make up the online centres network, reaching deep into communities to help people across the UK gain the support and skills they need to change their lives and overcome social challenges.

name: OPERA NORTH LIMITED
address: Howard Opera Centre, 8 Harrison Street, LEEDS, LEEDS
activities: The principal activities of the charity are to encourage the understanding and appreciation of the lyric art by providing, presenting, organising and conducting opera performances, symphony concerts and educational events primarily in the North of England.

name: ST.PETER'S SCHOOL, YORK
activities: St Peter's School is a day, boarding and preparatory school for boys and girls

name: LEMPRIERE PRINGLE 2015
address: Ord House, Little Fencote, NORTHALLERTON, North Yorkshire
activities: The Charity is principally concerned with supporting community needs via Christian ministries in England at the suggestion of the Trustees, rather than inviting unsolicited applications.  A main focus is supporting the regeneration of Bishop Auckland and surrounding area via its sister charities The Auckland Castle Trust, Zurbaran Trust and Eleven Arches.

name: CHRISTIANS AGAINST POVERTY
address: CHRISTIANS AGAINST POVERTY, JUBILEE MILL, 30 NORTH STREET, BRADFORD
activities: Christians Against Poverty offers a free debt counselling service to individuals and families releasing them from the pressure of debt through a combination of advice, financial education, budgeting and insolvency services. Operating through a network of local centres which are run in partnership with local churches, we aim to help anyone regardless of their religious beliefs.

name: HOLLYBANK TRUST
address: HOLLYBANK TRUST, FAR COMMON ROAD, MIRFIELD
activities: The provision of education, therapy, medical support and residential care for children and adults with profound and complex physical disabilities in a specialist school ,children's home and adult homes.

name: ST LAURENCE EDUCATION TRUST
activities: The main charitable activities were the provision of education to boys and girls from the ages of 3 to 18 through two independent schools, Ampleforth College and St Martin's Ampleforth.

name: DAWAT-E-ISLAMI UK
address: DAWAT E ISLAMI UK HEAD OFFICE, Faizan E Madina, Maudsley Street, BRADFORD
activities: To advance the Islamic faith and to help the poor and needy.

name: DONCASTER CULTURE AND LEISURE TRUST
address: The Dome, Doncaster Leisure Park, Bawtry Road, Doncaster
activities: The charity exists to manage the leisure and entertainment experience to improve the lives and wellbeing of our clients and their communities. Principally we target ourselves with promoting the benefit of the inhabitants of Doncaster and its environs by the provision of facilities for the recreation and leisure time occupation in the interests of social welfare.

name: ADVANCE HE
address: THE HIGHER EDUCATION ACADEMY, INNOVATION WAY, YORK SCIENCE PARK, YORK
activities: Advance HE's purpose is to advance the professional practice of higher education to improve outcomes for the benefit of students, staff and society. Advance HE has been created to be ?of and for the sector? and is jointly owned by GuildHE and Universities UK.

name: LHASA LIMITED
activities: The charity promotes public education through the development and use of computer-aided reasoning and information systems in chemistry and the chemistry-related sciences.

name: L'ARCHE
activities: Building Communities with people who have learning disabilities

name: THINKING SPACE FOR PHILOSOPHICAL DIALOGUE AND ENQUIRY C.I.C.
ACADEMY OF SUSTAINABLE FINANCE, ACCOUNTING, ACCOUNTABILITY & GOVERNANCE (ASFAAG) CIC
